definitions.definition: relating to the most basic and important parts of something; complete and detailed

examples.text: the need for **radical changes** in education
demands for radical reform of the law
radical differences between the two systems
This document marks a radical departure from earlier recommendations.

definitions.definition: new, different and likely to have a great effect

examples.text: a radical solution to the problem

definitions.definition: in favour of extreme and complete political or social change

examples.text: the radical wing of the party

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the senses ‘forming the root’ and ‘inherent’): from late Latin radicalis, from Latin radix, radic- ‘root’.
